body.name: KitchenAid Hard Anodized Nonstick Frying Pans/Skillet Set, 8.25 Inch and 10 Inch, Onyx Black

features: QUICK HEATING PERFORMANCE: Thick aluminum base and thinner side walls provide quick heat distribution and a lightweight, warp-resistant frying pan
MADE FOR EVERYDAY COOKING: KitchenAid frying pan is crafted from durable hard anodized aluminum that is 8x harder than traditional aluminum for quick heat distribution and everyday use
TRIPLE LAYER NONSTICK: Skillet interior has been finished with triple layer nonstick for long-lasting food release and easy cleaning
GOURMET UPGRADE: Handle rivets are finished with triple layer nonstick to release foods and keep the interior of the pan looking newer, longer
FRYING PAN SET INCLUDES: 8.25-inch frying pan and 10-inch frying pan to create flavorful entrees and complementary sides at once
SILICONE GRIP HANDLES: Dual riveted handle is finished with silicone grips to remain cooler while cooking on the stovetop
body.description: Enjoy crafting meals and signature dishes with the KitchenAid Hard Anodized Nonstick Frying Pan Set. Featuring thick, forged aluminum bases to provide quick heat distribution, while thinner side walls allow the pans to remain lightweight and warp-resistant. These 8.25-inch and 10-inch skillets have been crafted from durable hard anodized aluminum that is 8x harder than traditional aluminum for long-lasting everyday cooking. Fry pan interiors and handle rivets have been finished with triple-layer nonstick to effortlessly release foods and keep the pans looking newer, longer. Dual riveted stainless steel handles are finished with silicone grips to remain cooler while cooking when compared to traditional stainless steel handles. Oven safe to 400°F for stove-to-oven cooking and creating a wide range of recipes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best pot I’ve ever had!
reviews.reviewText: Have used my Cooks Essentials 6 quart hard anodized pot for 25 years. It’s been a great pot and still is but I needed one a bit larger. This 8 quart Kitchenaid is the best pot I’ve ever had. The handles are cool while cooking and cleanup is a breeze. Hard anodized is the way to go. Not too wide for my burners, more narrow on the bottom than the top and it fits just right. Plus if a pot can be considered beautiful, it most definitely is. Kitchenaid doesn’t disappoint!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 8 quarts, decent size, good non-stick interior and attractive outside. Matches my stove!
reviews.reviewText: This replaces a 45 + year old and well used Cephalon 10 quart stockpot. This new pot is large enough for empty nesters with occasional guests. It's also good for canning and making jam, as the largest jars I use any more are pint size. The cover is very sturdy but NOT vented. Hopefully that won't be an issue. I washed it in warm soapy water by hand and towel dried it. I don't recommend putting any non-stick pots/pans in the dishwasher. I just don't think it's a good idea. I also suggest plate/pot/pan separators between those items that "nest." It protects the individual items. They're inexpensive and well worth the effort and money. Comparative to other stockpots given the same size this is a good deal. I have a few KitchenAid pans and have always been satisfied with their performance.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Love that it is the size I need. Very well made. Right weight and easy to clean after use. Exactly as described.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars very nice pan
reviews.reviewText: love this pan, heat distribution is great, easy to cleanI like how deep it is with the straight sides so easy to stir things like stewsThe silicone on the cover handle is great too

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice, but scratches easily
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this frying pan to replace an old one that was scratched. This has high sides which is great for sauces and stir frying. I don't use metal utensils when cooking with the pan. However, it does scratch easily when storing it (stacking other pots on it, moving it around, etc.). Non-stick is pretty good so far. NOTE: wash several times before using [new] as there is a black dust covering (I took a paper towel and wiped over it after every cleaning to make sure it was gone).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is a good pot has weight to it and is sturdy , heats up fast and browns well. I’m happy with it!! I bought a ceramic set but the ceramic set doesn’t brown well at all or I should say it takes forever. I hardly use the ceramic set. This is my go to pot. Carmelizes onions in less than 10 minutes. A nice golden brown. Love it! I have a gas stove.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Love love love this kettle. Just right size. Not too big or too little. Quality is excellent Definitely would recommend

reviews.reviewerName: Mr.John Frame & Mrs. Mrs. Ruth Frame
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I love this Pot
reviews.reviewText: As a person of short stature, I have always had difficulty seeing the inside of most cooking pots due to their height. However, the Stewing pot I recently acquired is the first one that allows me to see the entire inside of the pot without having to stand on my toes. This makes it great and easy for me to clean. I intend to be the only one using this pot. It's quite amusing, really. The thickness of this pot is great and it's also not too heavy or too light it's perfect for me to make my mom's homemade spaghetti sauce from scratch. No more running to the kitchen every five minutes to make sure it's not starting to stick to the pot. Now for the real test to make a pot of homemade spaghetti and let it simmer all day and see that it don't stick is going to be the biggest thing. If it sticks I will come back and tell you all that it stuck to the pot if not then you know I'm happy and cooking everything I haven't cooked in years on the stove in fear it sticking and then burning in the pot for once it's stuck and if you don't change to another pot it will burn eventually. But nothing like cooking things all day on your stove. I just know I am going to love this pot. Best anniversary gift I have been given by far. Lol,

reviews.reviewTitle: My go to frying pan for family cooking.
reviews.reviewText: As another said, My frypan is easy to clean nothing sticks and is well made. I purchased the entire Kitchen Aid Set and since I liked it so much I decided to replace my old big pan with this one. Very happy, well worth the money. Too bad the company dealt with Purolator which meant my package showed up late.
Wish it was maybe a bit bigger, but the high sides are perfect! So much easier to cook pasta dishes!
